Package dev.gamekit.core

Class Application

java.lang.Object
dev.gamekit.core.Application
public abstract class Application extends Object
Application is the heart of a GameKit program. A game or application must extend this class to do anything with the engine.

It runs a fixed-step game update loop which protects against lag spikes. It also loads scenes, schedule animations and timeouts and quit the running instance. Use getInstance() to get the current instance from anywhere in your project to access its methods.

    • loadScene

      public void loadScene(Scene scene)
      Schedules a scene to be loaded after the end of the current frame

    • scheduleTask

      public void scheduleTask(Task task)
      Schedule a task to be executed immediately after the end of the current frame.

    • scheduleTask

      public void scheduleTask(Task task, long timeoutMs)
      Schedule a task to be executed after some timeout in milliseconds.

      If timeoutMs is zero, task is executed immediately after the current frame

    • scheduleAnimation

      public void scheduleAnimation(Animation animation)
      Schedule an Animation to run. Animations are updated before the scene's onUpdate() to ensure current values are available to the scene's next update cycle

    • quit

      public void quit()
      Quit the current Application by dispatching a WindowEvent.WINDOW_CLOSING event to the Window frame
